result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K Steinbarth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Upon successful completion of probation, the record shall be expunged pursuant to 973.015. Successful completion of probation includes no holds during the period of probation.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment within the first 30 days of RELEASE FROM CUSTODY and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael K Steinbarth in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Shelton heard on status - Def. will plead today to Count 1; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Poss. of THC; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; parties. stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Count 1 Poss. of THC w/Count 2 D&RI; State heard; Atty. Shelton heard ($100 F+C and exp.); Court imposes sentence; Def. is sitting for FDL Co. case; Def. remanded

**W/H - 1 year PO
- AODA within first 30 days of supervision and FT
- $243 CC
- $200 DNA surcharge
- No drugs, etc.
- Expungment upon successful completion of probation (no holds)
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

(12:47) Defendant Michael K Steinbarth in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan & believes def is eligible.  Law Intern Kevin Schmidt in person w/ Atty Gilbert Grant Thompson by phone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Return date scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
